Description: AWARD PURPOSE LOST HILLS WATER DISTRICT  LHWD  IS LOCATED IN WESTERN KERN COUNTY, CALIFORNIA, IN THE SOUTHERN END OF THE SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY  THE SERVICE AREA 1 CANAL RESERVOIR LINING PROJECT INCLUDES INSTALLATION OF  HIGH DENSITY POLYETHYLENE  HDPE LINER TO LINE TWO RESERVOIRS IN THE CANAL SYSTEM TO REDUCE SEEPAGE AND IMPROVE WATER RELIABILITY  THE PROJECT ALSO INCLUDES PROMOTION OF NATURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION SERVICE  NRCS  ON FARM WATER CONSERVATION PROGRAMS TO LHWD GROWERS  THE ESTIMATED REDUCTION IN SEEPAGE FROM HDPE LINING IS 158 ACRE FEET  AF  PER YEAR  PROMOTION OF NRCS PROGRAMS IS ALSO EXPECTED TO RESULT IN MORE THAN 158 AF OF ADDITIONAL WATER SAVINGS  ENERGY SAVINGS WILL BE REALIZED, AND GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS REDUCED BY ELIMINATING THE NEED TO REPLACE THE LOST WATER WITH OTHER SUPPLIES  THOSE SUPPLIES WOULD ALSO BE PUMPED THROUGH STATE AND FEDERAL WATER PROJECT PUMPS AS WELL AS THE DISTRICT S PUMP STATION AND FROM WATER BANKS THE LHWD PARTICIPATES IN ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED MOBILIZATION AND SITE PREPARATION   CONTRACTORS SHALL LOCATE EXISTING UTILITIES AND MOBILIZE EQUIPMENT CONSTRUCTION   SEDIMENT AND ASPHALT LINING SHALL BE REMOVED FROM THE RESERVOIRS  THE RESERVOIR SUBGRADE AND ANCHOR TRENCHES SHALL BE PREPARED, RESERVOIR LINING SHALL BE INSTALLED, AND ANCHOR TRENCHES SHALL BE BACKFILLED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS PERFORMANCE TESTING AND  DEMOBILIZATION   RESERVOIR LINING SHALL BE TESTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SPECIFICATIONS PROJECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES THE LINING SHALL REDUCE SEEPAGE, INCREASE WATER RELIABILITY, REDUCE MAINTENANCE EFFORTS, AND REDUCE THE POTENTIAL FOR RESERVOIR BREACHES  SEEPAGE LOSSES ARE ESPECIALLY DETRIMENTAL BECAUSE WATER SUPPLIES ARE VERY LIMITED, AND THE LOST WATER GOES INTO THE REGION S SALTY SHALLOW GROUNDWATER RATHER THAN RECHARGE AN AQUIFER THAT HAS BENEFICIAL USE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES LOST HILLS WATER DISTRICT S  LHWD  RESERVOIRS 1 1A AND 1 3 WERE BUILT WITH ASPHALT SLOPE PROTECTION AND CLAYEY SOIL BOTTOMS IN 1968 DURING CONSTRUCTION OF THE ORIGINAL DISTRICT DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM  THE RESERVOIRS HELP TO REGULATE FLOWS IN THE SERVICE AREA 1 CANAL SYSTEM THE CORCORAN IRRIGATION DISTRICT  CID  LOCATED IN CALIFORNIA, WITHIN KINGS COUNTY, APPROXIMATELY 2 25 MILES NORTH OF THE CITY OF CORCORAN, CALIFORNIA WILL CONSTRUCT CONVEYANCE IMPROVEMENTS, WHICH INCLUDE CONVERTING OPEN DITCH CANALS TO PIPELINES FOR CONVEYING WELL WATER TO MEET DEMANDS OF THE DISTRICT  THE PROJECT INCLUDES CONVERTING 4,100 FEET OF OPEN CANALS TO 18 INCH PVC PIPELINE TO INCREASE WATER USE EFFICIENCY AND RELIABILITY THROUGH OPTIMAL FLOW RATED AND REDUCTION IN LOSSES DUE TO SEEPAGE AND EVAPORATION  THE PIPELINE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE CLEARING, GRUBBING AND COMPACTION TO THE INVERT OF THE CANAL PRIOR TO INSTALLING THE PIPELINE  THE PIPELINE WILL BE INSTALLED IN THE BOTTOM OF THE EXISTING CANAL AND THEN COVERED WITH THE MATERIAL FROM THE BANKS OF THE CANAL  THERE WILL BE 3  DIAMETER AIR VENTS INSTALLED ALONG THE PIPELINE LENGTH, APPROXIMATELY EVERY 1,000 FEET  A BACK FLOW PREVENTER NEAR THE WELL HEAD WILL BE TO BE INSTALLED TO PREVENT WATER FROM ENTERING THE WELL
